evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25 during the historical dynamic understanding preliminary phase.

assumptions: The continued movement beyond TRP despite communication indicates coordination breakdown.
defeaters: If evidence showed clear procedural deviation without communication issues, or hardware failure causing the event.

quotes.exact_quote: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H4 shows communication among crew and a pushback continuation beyond the TRP despite the trainee stopping and instructor taking over, indicating a coordination breakdown rather than procedural deviation.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in whether the pushback continuation was due to communication failure or procedural deviation.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with the key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident, reflecting typical patterns of crew interaction failures.

assumptions: Assuming that the continued movement beyond the TRP despite crew communication indicates a coordination breakdown.
Assuming no significant mechanical or environmental failures contributed to the incident.
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination without errors or if mechanical or environmental factors were primary causes, this would change the assessment.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and available within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 historical dynamic understanding preliminary data.

assumptions: The historical data H1-H4 constitute the 'historical dynamic understanding preliminary data' mentioned in the claim.
The presence of the TRP ground markings implies availability of procedural documentation.
defeaters: If evidence showed that the ground markings were inadequate or not visible, this would favor environmental deficiency over procedural deviation.
If mechanical control failure or communication breakdown evidence emerged, it could change the interpretation.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 directly documents the procedural deviation in pushback execution by describing the aircraft moving beyond the designated Tug release point and hitting the blast barrier, supporting the claim that the deviation is documented and available. The discriminator disc:R1_PUSHBACK_PROCEDURAL_DEVIATION|R3_ENVIRONMENT_OR_MARKING_DEFICIENCY favors procedural deviation over environmental deficiency.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with the key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 historical dynamic understanding preliminary data, reflecting typical operational contexts and conditions.

node.statement: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident is robust against alternative interpretations or defeaters, maintaining its validity in the preliminary analysis.

assumptions: No mechanical faults occurred as none were reported in the evidence.
Communication via interphone and visual cues was the primary coordination method.
defeaters: If evidence of corroborated hardware faults or mechanical control failures were found, this would challenge the communication breakdown explanation.
If communication logs showed no breakdown or full coordination, the explanation would be weakened.
